name: 4.24 AP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer (SIL) - B/2 Materials (Pavement Type A,B,C)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The crushing resistance shall be not less than 100kN when the aggregate is tested in accordance with NZS:4407: Test 3.10
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The aggregate shall have a weathering quality index of AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA when tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.11.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The material shall have a minimum CBR of 40 when compacted to New Zealand heavy compaction standard in accordance with NZS4402 Test 4.1.2 at water content between 4% and 6% by weight of aggregate. CBR testing shall be in accordance with NZS 4407 Test 3.15.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine, Broken Face Content, Grading, Aggergate Fractions, and Be free of organic matter.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - In each of the aggregate fractions between the 63.0mm and 4.75mm sieves, not less than 50% by weight shall have two or more broken faces. It shall be free of organic matter.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sand equivalent shall not be less than 30 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: 1991: Test 3.6. The sand equivalent test may be neglected if the grading test shows less than 4% passing the 75-micron sieve.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Plasticity Index shall be no less than 8 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: Test 3.4.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Clay Index shall be no less than 5 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: Test 3.5

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.8.1 Standard Method by Wet Sieving or Test 3.8.2 Subsidiary Method by Dry Sieving, the grading of the aggregate shall fall within their respective envelopes defined below or as directed by the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for SIL construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density using Heavy compaction.
4.25 WHAP65 Sub-Base - B/2 Materials (Pavement Type C)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The WHAP65 Sub-Base shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The crushing resistance shall be not less than 130kN when the aggregate is tested in accordance with NZS:4407: Test 3.10
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The aggregate shall have a weathering quality index of AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA when tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.11.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The material shall have a minimum CBR of 40 when compacted to New Zealand heavy compaction standard in accordance with NZS4402 Test 4.1.2 at water content between 4% and 6% by weight of aggregate. CBR testing shall be in accordance with NZS 4407 Test 3.15.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The WHAP65 Sub-Base shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine, Broken Face Content, Grading, Aggergate Fractions, and Be free of organic matter.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - In each of the aggregate fractions between the 63.0mm and 4.75mm sieves, not less than 50% by weight shall have two or more broken faces. It shall be free of organic matter.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sand equivalent shall not be less than 25 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: 1991: Test 3.6. The sand equivalent test may be neglected if the grading test shows less than 4% passing the 75-micron sieve.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.8.1 Standard Method by Wet Sieving or Test 3.8.2 Subsidiary Method by Dry Sieving, the grading of the aggregate shall fall within their respective envelopes defined below or as directed by the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for WHAP65 Sub-Base construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density using Heavy compaction.
4.26 GAP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer - B/2 Materials
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The GAP65 SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The GAP65 SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine, Broken Face Content, Grading, Aggergate Fractions, and Be free of organic matter.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for GAP65 SIL construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density using Heavy compaction.
4.28 TNZ M/4 - AP40 Material Approval (Pavement Type C,D)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.
Standard / Specification - PS 20.8.1 TNZ M/4: 2006 - 3, NZS 4407 : 1991, NZS 4402 : 1986

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When tested in accordance with NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.10, The Crushing Resistance Test, under a load of 130 kN less than 10% fines passing 2.36 mm sieve size shall be produced.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 3.3.1
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The aggregate shall have a quality index of AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA when tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.11.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 3.3.2
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sample shall be:
(a) compacted in accordance with NZS 4402 : 1986, Test 4.1.3 New Zealand
○ Vibrating Hammer Compaction Test at Optimum Water Content and;

(b) tested in accordance with NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.15 The California Bearing Ratio Test (without a surcharge for at least 4 days). The soaked CBR of the basecourse aggregate shall not be less than 80%.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 3.3.3

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine as per PS 20.8.1, Broken Face Content, and WET Particle Size Distribution Limits and Shape Control.
Standard / Specification - PS 20.8.1 TNZ M/4: 2006 - 4, NZS 4407 : 1991
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sand equivalent shall not be less than 40 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: 1991: Test 3.6.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 4.2.1.1

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The clay index of the fraction of basecourse passing the 75μm sieve shall not be greater than 3 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.5 Clay Index Test.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 4.2.1.2

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plasticity index of the fraction of basecourse passing the 425μm sieve shall not be greater than 5 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.4 Plasticity Index Test.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 4.2.1.3

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The aggregate broken face content in each of the three aggregate fractions between the 37.5mm and 4.75mm sieves shall not be less than 70% by weight and shall have two or more broken faces, when tested according to NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.14 Broken Face Test.
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 4.2.2

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The particle-size distribution of the aggregate shall conform with the envelope limits defined in both Tables 2 and 3 below, when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407 : 1991, Test 3.8.1 Wet Sieving Test.

○ If testing has been performed to show that the dry sieving method is not significantly different to the wet sieving method at 95% confidence limit for the same aggregate then dry sieving method may be used.
Table 2: Particle Size Distribution Envelope Limits for an Individual Sample
Test Sieve Aperture || AP40 (Max size 40mm) || AP20 (Max size 20mm)
Table 3: Particle Size Distribution Shape Control
Standard / Specification - TNZ M/4 Spec Clause 4.2.3
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density at optimum water content (OWC).
Standard / Specification - PS 20.8.1 TNZ B/02: 2005 - 7.5 NZS 4402:1986 - 4.1.3
4.30 NZTA M27 2020 - STONE MASTIC ASPHALT MATERIALS
4.30.01 - Coarse Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Coarse Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Weathering Quality Index, Crushing Resistance, Broken Faces, Bulk SG and Density, Absorption, and Particle Size Distribution
Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.
4.30.02 - Fine Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Fine Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Sand Equivalent, Bulk SG and Density, Absorption, and Particle Size Distribution
Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filler shall be consistent in mineral composition. It shall be dry, and free from lumps, clay, organic matter or other material deleterious to asphalt.
Standard / Specification - PS 21.3.1 NZTA M27:2020 - 2.2 ASTM D242
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01-A specification.
Standard / Specification - PS 21.3.1 NZTA M27:2020 - 2.4.1, NZTA M01-A

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor’s mix design shall be assessed by the Engineer for compliance with the requirements of this specification including a production trial, job mix formula, and be currently Validated. The Engineer’s approval of the mix design is a prerequisite for its use.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.
Frequency - One test per grade supplied
4.32.01 - Sealing Chip - Source Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Resistance, Weak Particles Test, Skid Resistance, and PSV
Frequency - Before Supply and Every 10,000m3 Thereafter
4.32.02 - Sealing Chip - Production Property Test Sampling
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Cleanness, Size and Shape, and PSD for G5 / G6
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.
Frequency - One test per grade supplied
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder shall have benchmark parameter testing completed complying with the requirements of NZTA Q05.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When used, Adhesion agents must be approved & blended in accordance with the requirements of TNZ M/13 Specification for Adhesion Agents.
Verifying Document - Binder Aggregate Adhesion Test
Frequency - Each Adhesion Agent and Dosage Rate for a Particular Chip Source

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder shall be applied with a bitumen distributor, operated in accordance with BCA E/2, Specification for Performance of Bitumen Distributors administered by the New Zealand Bitumen Contractors' Association Inc.
Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ P4
13.02 AP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer Pavement Type A,B,C
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Dimensional tolerances, uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored throughout

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC. The Contractor shall determine the minimum number of roller passes required to produce pavement layer compaction at OWC.
Verifying Document - MDD and Plateau Reports
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 95 Minimum Value ≥ 92
Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot 1000m2 max lot size
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL layer shall be monitored for Layer thickness.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The standard of smoothness shall be such that there is no point in the surface that varies more than 10 mm from a 3 m straight edge placed on the road and any deviation from the straight edge is gradual.
Verifying Document - Survey / Straight edge Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No area of the completed surface shall have any depression that will allow water to pond where lateral or longitudinal fall is greater than 1%

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - SIL layers shall be proof rolled with a minimum 10 Tonne static weight smooth drum roller, or a heavy pneumatic tyred roller (PTR) to identify any soft spots. The criteria for acceptance of the sub-base proof rolling shall be a settlement under the tyre not exceeding 5mm for one pass.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - be ˂ 1.5mm (95th%) and max ≤1.8mm
13.03 Construction Of Unbound WHAP65 Sub-Base Pavement Type C
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Dimensional tolerances, uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored throughout

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC. The Contractor shall determine the minimum number of roller passes required to produce pavement layer compaction at OWC.
Verifying Document - MDD and Plateau Reports
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 95 Minimum Value ≥ 92
Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot 1000m2 max lot size
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sub-basecourse shall be monitored for Layer thickness.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The standard of smoothness shall be such that there is no point in the surface that varies more than 10 mm from a 3 m straight edge placed on the road and any deviation from the straight edge is gradual.
Verifying Document - Survey / Straight edge Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No area of the completed surface shall have any depression that will allow water to pond where lateral or longitudinal fall is greater than 1%

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sub-base layers shall be proof rolled with a minimum 10 Tonne static weight smooth drum roller, or a heavy pneumatic tyred roller (PTR) to identify any soft spots. The criteria for acceptance of the sub-base proof rolling shall be a settlement under the tyre not exceeding 5mm for one pass.
13.07 Construction Of Basecourse – NZTA M/4 AP40 Pavement Type C
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Dimensional tolerances, uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored throughout
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC.
Verifying Document - MDD and Plateau Reports
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall determine the minimum number of roller passes required to produce pavement layer compaction at OWC.
Verifying Document - MDD and Plateau Reports
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mean Value ≥ 98 Minimum Value ≥ 95
Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot 1000m2 max lot size
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Basecourse shall be monitored for Layer thickness.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The standard of smoothness shall be such that there is no point in the surface that varies more than 10 mm from a 3 m straight edge placed on the road and any deviation from the straight edge is gradual..
Verifying Document - Survey / Straight edge Report
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No area of the completed surface shall have any depression that will allow water to pond where lateral or longitudinal fall is greater than 1%

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - If running course is used it shall be spread uniformly over the pavement surface and maintained until removed. During working hours traffic shall be channelised by suitably defined traffic lanes with frequent transverse shifts of the defined lanes to obtain an even spread of traffic over the entire surface.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The basecourse surface finish, as distinct from the surface shape, shall present a tightly consolidated surface when swept.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The longitudinal smoothness of the final surfacing layer shall comply with the maximum NAASRA roughness value detailed in the specific contract requirements.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The seal coat shall not be applied unless the water content at each test point of the basecourse layer is such that the degree of saturation (DOS) is less than 60%.
Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot 1000m2 max lot size
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sealing shall be carried out in accordance with TNZ or NZTA Specifications M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, P4, P17, and Q/1.
Standard / Specification - M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, P4, P17, and Q/1.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sealing design including binder application rate to suit the surface conditions shall be approved by the Design Engineer prior to sealing.
Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ P4

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The seal coat shall not be applied unless the water content at each test point of the basecourse layer is such that the degree of saturation (DOS) is less than 60%.
Frequency - Min 5 Tests Per Lot 1000m2 Max Lot Size

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The road shall be reasonably dry before the binder is applied, and no spraying with asphaltic binder shall be carried out when the air temperature measured within the confines of the sealing course is below 10oC in the shade. The Engineer shall be given the opportunity to inspect the site.
Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ B02
Frequency - A minimum of 24 hours’ notice of intention to seal.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The emulsified asphalt may be sprayed at the temperature at which it is received from the manufacturing plant except that no emulsified asphalt shall be sprayed at a temperature in excess of 90oC or below 20oC.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A minimum of two samples per bitumen distributor load shall be taken. The first of these samples shall be taken at the end of the initial spray run and the other immediately before the final spray run. Bitumen to be tested on Engineers instruction.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The quantity of binder sprayed in any spray run, measured by dipstick reading, shall not vary from the amount directed by more than 50 litres plus 4% of the amount directed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All binder sprayed shall be covered with chips across the full sprayed width, apart from necessary longitudinal laps, within five minutes of spraying.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Surplus chips shall be removed from the sealed surface prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction signs.
Frequency - 24 hours of Completion of any Section of Seal.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer will inspect the sealcoat immediately prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction and after final surplus chip removal is completed.
Frequency - Prior to TM Removal and After Final Sweeping
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall make no repairs without the prior approval of the Engineer for the methods to be used.
14.03 Construction Activity - NZTA M10 - Specification for dense-graded asphaltic concrete

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where a construction trial is specified in the contract, and not less than two days before the site work is due to commence, all the Contractor’s plant and personnel proposed for use on the job shall carry out a construction trial in the presence of the Engineer. Asphalt manufactured in the production trial can also be used in the construction trial if it meets the requirements of the specification.
Frequency - As Required, two days before the site work is due to commence.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prepare and submit a paving plan to the Engineer for approval not less than 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.
Frequency - 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.
14.03.03 - Preparation of Area to be Paved

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surface on which the paving is to be laid shall be free from standing water, and any loose material, dust, clay or foreign matter shall be removed by sweeping. All fatty and unsuitable patches shall be removed. Depressions and other irregularities shall be patched or corrected.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prevent tack coat, binder, aggregate, asphalt or other material used on the work from entering, adhering or obstructing gratings, hydrants, valve boxes, inspection pit covers, kerbs and other road fixtures
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C, for SAC the minimum temperature is 5°C

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Tack coat shall be applied to the cleaned surface prior to placing asphalt. Tack coats shall be applied using a distributor. The use of a hand lance shall be minimised to ensure an even application of the tack coat.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Conforming Grading and Binder content by mass
Frequency - 1 per 200T, Min 3 tests per mix
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The layer thickness determined from measurements on the cores LCV of no less than the specified thickness - refer clause 9.7
Frequency - min 8 per lot (day) (1 for every 300 m²)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 150 mm nominal diameter Cores shall be cut from the pavement at a rate of one core for every 300m² with a minimum of eight cores representing each lot
Standard / Specification - ASTM D5361 NZTA M10:2020 - 9
Frequency - min 8 per lot (day) (1 for every 300 m²)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 150 mm nominal diameter Cores shall be taken from randomly located distances along joints at the rate of one per 100m of joint with a minimum of three representing each lot
Frequency - min 3 per lot (day) (1 per 100 m of joint)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The upper and lower characteristic values of in-situ air voids for that lot shall comply within the maximum and minimum characteristic limits specified in Table 9.2
Frequency - within 24 hours of them being cut from the pavement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDMs are to be completed at the time of placing to ensure compliance when cores are taken

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The transverse truth of the surface shall be checked with a 3 m straight edge over the straight cross-fall portion of the cross-section for irregularities, which vary more than 5 mm under this straight edge.
14.03.14 - Finished Pavement Level, Alignment, and Thickness

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The level at the top of each layer of asphalt, horizontal location of any point on the pavement, and specified layer thickness shall be surveyed and conform with tolerances and contract requirements.
14.04 Construction Activity - NZTA M27 - Specification for stone mastic asphalt.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where a construction trial is specified in the contract, and not less than two days before the site work is due to commence, all the Contractor’s plant and personnel proposed for use on the job shall carry out a construction trial in the presence of the Engineer. SMA manufactured in the production trial can also be used in the construction trial provided that it meets the requirements of the specification.
Frequency - As Required, two days before the site work is due to commence.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prepare and submit a paving plan to the Engineer for approval not less than 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.
Frequency - 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.
14.04.03 - Preparation of Area to be Paved

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surface on which the paving is to be laid shall be free from standing water, and any loose material, dust, clay or foreign matter shall be removed by sweeping. All fatty and unsuitable patches shall be removed. Depressions and other irregularities shall be patched or corrected.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prevent tack coat, binder, aggregate, asphalt or other material used on the work from entering, adhering or obstructing gratings, hydrants, valve boxes, inspection pit covers, kerbs and other road fixtures
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C,

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Tack coat shall be applied to the cleaned surface prior to placing asphalt. Tack coats shall be applied using a distributor. The use of a hand lance shall be minimised to ensure an even application of the tack coat. Where SMA is to be spread over clean, freshly placed asphalt, the Engineer can direct the Contractor to omit the tack coat.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Conforming Grading and Binder content by mass
Frequency - 1 per 200T, Min 3 tests per mix
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The M/27:2020 requirement is LCV of no less than the specified thickness - refere clause 9.7
Frequency - min 8 per lot (day) (1 for every 300 m²)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 150 mm nominal diameter Cores shall be cut from the pavement at a rate of one core for every 300 m² with a minimum of eight cores representing each lot
Standard / Specification - ASTM D5361 NZTA M27:2020 - 9
Frequency - min 8 per lot (day) (1 for every 300 m²)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 150 mm nominal diameter Cores shall be taken from randomly located distances along joints at the rate of one per 100 m of joint with a minimum of three representing each lot
Frequency - min 3 per lot (day) (1 per 100 m of joint)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The upper and lower characteristic values of in-situ air voids for that lot shall comply within the maximum and minimum characteristic limits specified in Table 9.2
Frequency - within 24 hours of them being cut from the pavement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDMs are to be completed at the time of pacing to ensure compile when cores are taken

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The transverse truth of the surface shall be checked with a 3 m straight edge over the straight cross-fall portion of the cross-section for irregularities, which vary more than 5 mm under this straight edge.
14.04.14 - Finished Pavement Level, Alignment, and Thickness

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The level at the top of each layer of asphalt, horizontal location of any point on the pavement, and specified layer thickness shall be surveyed and conform with tolerances and contract requirements.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Target is an average of 60 NAASRA counts/km for the 100m moving average Maximum 100m moving average of 70 NAASRA counts/km. No 20m reading in any lane shall exceed 100 NAASRA counts/km.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Target is an average of 50 NAASRA counts/km for the 100m moving average Maximum 100m moving average of 60 NAASRA counts/km. No 20m reading in any lane shall exceed 100 NAASRA counts/km.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surfacing shall meet the requirements specified in the Transport Agency’s T10:2010 Skid Resistance Deficiency Investigation and Treatment Selection, and any other subsequent amendments.
Verifying Document - Prior to Project Completion
